meanings.definition: To remove the masts from (a ship).
meanings.sent1: The sailors dismasted the old ship before repairing it.
meanings.sent2: The crew dismasted the vessel to make it easier to transport.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous pirates dismasted the ship as a prank.
meanings.sent4: The storm dismasted the ship, leaving it vulnerable in the sea.
meanings.sent5: The decision to dismast the ship saved it from sinking during the storm.

meanings.definition: Having lost one or more masts.
meanings.sent1: The dismasted ship struggled to navigate the rough waters.
meanings.sent2: The dismasted vessel awaited rescue in the open sea.
meanings.sent3: The dismasted boat looked quite peculiar without its masts.
meanings.sent4: The dismasted yacht served as a reminder of the powerful storm.
meanings.sent5: The dismasted sailboat bobbed helplessly in the ocean.
